meta.description: Language labels for CSH tables/fields belonging to extension 'pmkglossary'

languageKey.label: The catchword is used to locate the entry, and dictates its alphabetical position.
The catchword description is used to describe the meaning of the catchword.
Check this box if you wish to hide the glossary element from being displayed.
Insert an image.

You can attach an image to the glossary element.
Depending on the configuration of TYPO3 you can even attach them in any format you like. Especially you do not need to worry about size and compression because these factors are normally handled by TYPO3 internally.

When you use the "Text w/image" type, it's important to select a proper position of the imageblock. For this purpose, use the Position selector which is displayed below (or if you click in the image list field in the Classic backend).
Select the position of the imageblock relative to the body text.

The position above and below the body text is pretty straight forward.
The options "In text" means that the image block is displayed with text aside it. When you select this option the template will probably force the images into smaller dimensions because they cannot take up the same space when text is supposed to float around them.
When you select "In text" you can choose the options either above or below the divider "No wrap". If you select the "In text" option above, the bodytext will float under the image block when the bodytext reaches the end of the image block. So in other words the body text wraps around the image block. If you select "In text" below the "No wrap" divider, the body text will not float under the image block, but simply continue in its column.
Enter the width in pixels of the image.

The template is normally configured to a max width of an image and so you don't need to specify the width if the image fits perfectly into those dimensions. However this does give you an opportunity to specify a specific width.
Select the record in the default language, which corresponds to this record.

Select the system language of this element.
Notice this will affect whether the element is visible.

This allows you to assign a specific language to the content element. If you select anything but the default value, the element will not be visible unless the language assigned is also configured by the TypoScript template.
The available system languages are created by the administrator.
